text:
Have another question about the Quickstart. I created several OAuth2 users under the AppUser realm in Keycloak, and added a simple IoU template to the `/quickstart/daml/iou` (in parallel with the `licensing` folder)
```module IouTemplate.Iou where

template IouHolding
  with
    issuer : Party
    owner : Party
    currency : Text
    amount : Decimal
    observers : [Party]
  where
    signatory issuer, owner
    observer observers

    ensure amount > 0.0

    choice Iou_Split : (ContractId IouHolding, ContractId IouHolding)
        with
        splitAmount: Decimal
      controller owner
      do
        let restAmount = amount - splitAmount
        splitCid <- create this with amount = splitAmount
        restCid <- create this with amount = restAmount
        return (splitCid, restCid)```
And try to submit a create command via the JSON Ledger API
```<http://localhost:2975/v2/commands/submit-and-wait>```
with this payload:
```{
    "actAs": [
        "63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4"
    ],
    "userId": "92a520cb-2f09-4e55-b465-d178c6cfe5e4",
    "commandId": "create-iou-1754302424",
    "commands": [
        {
            "CreateCommand": {
                "createArguments": {
                    "observers": [],
                    "issuer": "63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4",
                    "owner": "63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4",
                    "amount": "500",
                    "currency": "USD"
                },
                "templateId": "#quickstart-iou:IouTemplate.Iou:IouHolding"
            }
        }
    ]
}```
At this point I tried to get the Bearer Token from this API `<http://keycloak.localhost:8082/realms/AppUser/protocol/openid-connect/token>` with this party's user name and password `63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4` but the command returned this error, indicating that this authentication has failed.
```Request failed with HTTP status code 403
Response body: {"code":"NA","cause":"A security-sensitive error has been received","correlationId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","traceId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","context":{},"resources":[],"errorCategory":-1,"grpcCodeValue":7,"retryInfo":null,"definiteAnswer":null}```
This is the decoded bearer token
```{
    "alg": "RS256",
    "typ": "JWT",
    "kid": "eZ7Gro40xD6FxMT7Suxmjwvl5-YZKiQUMHLAeNQpRbw"
},
{
    "exp": 1754302845,
    "iat": 1754302545,
    "jti": "33579c25-7c8c-4934-9e0c-f194c717c1b1",
    "iss": "<http://keycloak.localhost:8082/realms/AppUser>",
    "aud": ["<https://canton.network.global>", "account"],
    "sub": "63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867",
    "typ": "Bearer",
    "azp": "app-user-unsafe",
    "sid": "ac8676d3-bb03-4fa7-9b8d-76f1614126f2",
    "acr": "1",
    "allowed-origins": ["/*"],
    "realm_access": {
        "roles": [
            "offline_access",
            "uma_authorization",
            "default-roles-appuser"
        ]
    },
    "resource_access": {
        "account": {
            "roles": [
                "manage-account",
                "manage-account-links",
                "view-profile"
            ]
        }
    },
    "scope": "openid profile email",
    "email_verified": true,
    "name": "Anh Le",
    "preferred_username": "alh",
    "given_name": "Anh",
    "family_name": "Le",
    "email": "alh@app-user.localhost"
}```
Any help is much appreciated!

text:
<@U08VA56KACF> confirming that the answers to 1 and 2 are correct.

For 3: you can batch topology transactions together with other topology txs but not with Daml transactions.

Namespace delegation, party to participant and party to key mappings are topology transactions

Preapproval is a Daml transaction,

elements.text:

text: Hello! I am trying to programmatically invoke the devnet faucet for an external party. I tried to exercise `AmuletRules_DevNet_Tap`  on the `AmuletRules` contract returned by scan API, but it fails as contract cannot be found on my validator node. I'm a bit confused how it works through the `WalletAppInstall` one, could I get any pointers ?

text:
1. get in the habit of checking canton log whenever you see error like this:
```Request failed with HTTP status code 403
Response body: {"code":"NA","cause":"A security-sensitive error has been received","correlationId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","traceId":"ec96936b50b5a45dac754d955376f792","context":{},"resources":[],"errorCategory":-1,"grpcCodeValue":7,"retryInfo":null,"definiteAnswer":null}```
search by correlationId and very likely you will find more detail around the line you found explaining why you see the error

elements.text: get in the habit of checking canton log whenever you see error like this:

search by correlationId and very likely you will find more detail around the line you found explaining why you see the error

text:
2.  Did you assign rights to the ledger user `63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867`
to act as the party `63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4` ?

elements.text: 2.  Did you assign rights to the ledger user
to act as the party
63f4782e-8bc0-498a-998a-bf8caee2d867::1220afec1736aec0fdcf211f7d16cb0e9513cec13bba1a0737f7b066bf8b977c51b4

text:
3. in the payload
```"userId": "92a520cb-2f09-4e55-b465-d178c6cfe5e4",```
should be the userId of the user you created and whose token you are sending with the request and you can as well omit it completely since you are sending jwt token.

elements.text: 3. in the payload
should be the userId of the user you created and whose token you are sending with the request and you can as well omit it completely since you are sending jwt token.

text:
Hi all. is there a way to test the deployment of the current versions Quickstart UI/Frontend onto devnet / or testnet nodes? Can i easily get the image and define it in the node config to deploy?

Wondering if its possible currently and what steps would be required if it is. More so wanting to test and practice deployment of UIs/frontend to a node <@U02SR6E8Z9S> <@UL9TWDFL2> . Thinking to test using QS might be easier since its already developed or whether it’s easier to spin something up to test deployment. I am able to install the dars fine

Thanks for any pointers here

elements.text:
Hi all. is there a way to test the deployment of the current versions Quickstart UI/Frontend onto devnet / or testnet nodes? Can i easily get the image and define it in the node config to deploy?

Wondering if its possible currently and what steps would be required if it is. More so wanting to test and practice deployment of UIs/frontend to a node

. Thinking to test using QS might be easier since its already developed or whether it’s easier to spin something up to test deployment. I am able to install the dars fine

Thanks for any pointers here

text:
Hi, we have it on our backlog to provide a 'deployment' that would dovetail into an existing validator deployment (already existing).

The alternative is to run the app locally - you would essentially pick the non-LocalNet components to run locally and configure them to talk to devnet. Keep in mind that you need to target a specific verison of Quickstart that relates to the version on dev/test net (they are different). We have git tags that provide this information for historical Splice version compatibility.

elements.text:

Keep in mind that you need to target a specific verison of Quickstart that relates to the version on dev/test net (they are different). We have git tags that provide this information for historical Splice version compatibility.

text: That would be up to you if you run it: locally in docker or in a Helm context? But at this point we have not mapped out all the manual steps. (we would need to make arbitrary selections on those choices)

text: AmuletTransferInstruction is only used for the offer/accept flow. You may want to consider querying for the `TransferInstruction` interface though which also works for other assets following the token standard. For preapprovals there is no intermediate template, it just directly exercises TransferPreapproval_Send which then transfers the CC.

elements.text: AmuletTransferInstruction is only used for the offer/accept flow. You may want to consider querying for the
TransferInstruction

interface though which also works for other assets following the token standard. For preapprovals there is no intermediate template, it just directly exercises TransferPreapproval_Send which then transfers the CC.

text: Only the endpoints under /external-party/ works for external parties. If you want to tap you would need to do so directly against the ledger API through the external signing APIs.
